net.stemkoski.bagel

Class Rectangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.stemkoski.bagel.Rectangle

  • public class Rectangle
extends java.lang.Object
    A rectangle shape, defined by its position and size, particularly useful in collision detection (see Sprite, TileMap) and for specifying area of an image to be drawn (see Texture). Rectangles with width or height equal to 0 can be used to represent edges (see Tile.edgeLeft, etc.)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) double bottom
      y-coordinate of bottom edge of rectangle
      (package private) double height
      height of rectangle

      x-coordinate of left edge of rectangle
      (package private) double right
      x-coordinate of right edge of rectangle
      (package private) double top
      y-coordinate of top edge of rectangle
      (package private) double width
      width of rectangle

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rectangle()
      Initialize rectangle with all values set to 0.
      Rectangle(double left, double top, double width, double height)
      Initialize rectangle data from coordinates of top-left corner and size.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) boolean contains(double x, double y)
      Determine if this rectangle contains the point (x,y).
      (package private) Vector2 getMinTranslationVector(Rectangle other)
      Assuming that this rectangle and other rectangle overlap, calculate the minimum length vector required to translate this rectangle so that there is no longer any overlap between them.
      (package private) boolean overlaps(Rectangle other)
      Determine if this rectangle overlaps with other rectangle.
      (package private) void setValues(double left, double top, double width, double height)
      Update rectangle data from coordinates of top-left corner and size.

        Rectangle(double left,
          double top,
          double width,
          double height)
        Initialize rectangle data from coordinates of top-left corner and size.
        Parameters:
        left - x-coordinate of top-left corner (left edge) of rectangle
        top - y-coordinate of top-left corner (top edge) of rectangle
        width - width of rectangle
        height - height of rectangle

    • Method Detail

      • setValues

        void setValues(double left,
               double top,
               double width,
               double height)
        Update rectangle data from coordinates of top-left corner and size. Useful for game entities that move.
        Parameters:
        left - x-coordinate of top-left corner (left edge) of rectangle
        top - y-coordinate of top-left corner (top edge) of rectangle
        width - width of rectangle
        height - height of rectangle

      • overlaps

        boolean overlaps(Rectangle other)
        Determine if this rectangle overlaps with other rectangle.
        Parameters:
        other - rectangle to check for overlap
        Returns:
        true if this rectangle overlaps with other rectangle

      • getMinTranslationVector

        Vector2 getMinTranslationVector(Rectangle other)
        Assuming that this rectangle and other rectangle overlap, calculate the minimum length vector required to translate this rectangle so that there is no longer any overlap between them.
        Parameters:
        other - rectangle to translate away from
        Returns:
        minimum length vector required to translate by to avoid overlap

      • contains

        boolean contains(double x,
                 double y)
        Determine if this rectangle contains the point (x,y).
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of point
        y - y-coordinate of point
        Returns:
        true, if this rectangle contains the point (x,y)
